page.title: 07Honey Farming On Tweedside
page.content: About a mile down the River Tweed from Horncliffe near the Chain Bridge, is a honey farm of 1000 hives of bees run by the Robson family. These bees are kept within a radius of 30 miles and produce on average about 25 tons of honey each year. The hives are moved thrice a year from sheltered sites in the winter, to the oil seed rape fields in the Spring and then to the the Lammermuir Hills or to Chatton Moors for the heather honey in August. The honey is extracted and processed by the Robsons at their works at their home. The products being packed for sale into various types of container ranging from plastic pots to specially produced decorated pots. These products are marketed by the family and by retail outlets in England and Scotland.
